title: Two economic powerhouses have a sit down
contentencoded: This week, Treasury Secretary Jack Lew will be in Germany to meet with his counterpart, Wolfgang Schäuble. On the agenda is the U.S. Treasury's criticism that Germany is putting too much emphasis on selling to the rest of Europe, instead of buying more. The U.S. says this bias toward domestic consumption hurts the rest of Europe, but Germany may not be in the mood to be told what do by the U.S. The BBC's Damien McGuinness reports from Berlin. Click the audio player above to hear more.
description: This week, the U.S. and Germany will sit down to talk economy.
itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Monday, January 6, 2014
teaser: This week, the U.S. and Germany will sit down to talk economy.
